conclusion: The y-axis represents position x in meters
The x-axis represents time t in seconds
There's a straight line with a positive slope
The line extends back to t = -2 s
A position-time graph with a straight line indicates constant velocity
The slope of the line gives us the velocity of the vehicle
To find velocity, calculate the slope of the line: Slope = rise/run = Δx/Δt
The line is straight and has a positive slope
The question asks for the car's acceleration
Acceleration is the rate of change of velocity with respect to time
Since the position-time graph is a straight line, velocity is constant
When velocity is constant, acceleration = 0 m/s²
In a position-time graph, a straight line represents constant velocity (zero acceleration)
A curved line would indicate changing velocity (non-zero acceleration)
Since the graph shows a straight line throughout the observed time period, the acceleration remains zero
The car's acceleration from the start of timing is 0 m/s²
